qas.question: What is the conventional method to measure the Rhine?
When was the scale to measure the Rhine introduced?
Where does the Rhine river's measurement begin?

answers.text: the Old Rhine Bridge at Constance

qas.question: Where does the Rhine river's measurement end?
What has shortened the Rhine river?

answers.text: the river's natural course due to number of canalisation projects completed in the 19th and 20th century

qas.question: What is the conventional measurement of the Rhine?
When was the measurement of the Rhine introduced?

answers.text: the Old Rhine Bridge at Constance

qas.question: Why has the Rhine been shortened?

answers.text: from the river's natural course due to number of canalisation projects completed in the 19th and 20th century

qas.question: What is the length of the Old Rhine Bridge at Constance?
What is the length of Hoek van Holland conventionally measured in?
In what year was the Old Rhine Bridge shortened?
In what year did Hoek van Holland begin canalization projects?

context: The length of the Rhine is conventionally measured in <a0_2>"<a0_0><a0_1><a0_3><a0_4><a5_0><a5_1><a5_3><a5_4><b11_0>Rhine-kilometers<b11_0/><a5_4/><a5_3/><a5_1/><a0_4/><a0_3/><a0_1/><a0_0/>"<a5_0/><a0_2/> (Rheinkilometer), a scale introduced in <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4><a6_0><a6_1><a6_2><a6_3><b12_0><b13_0>1939<b13_0/><b12_0/><a6_3/><a6_2/><a6_1/><a6_0/><a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> which runs from <a2_2><a7_2>the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_3><a2_4><a7_0><a7_1><a7_3><a7_4>Old Rhine Bridge<a7_4/><a2_4/> at Constance<a7_3/><a7_2/><a7_1/><a7_0/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> (0 km) to <a3_0><a3_1><a3_3><a3_4><a8_0><a8_1><a8_2><a8_3><a8_4>Hoek van Holland<a8_4/><a8_3/><a8_2/><a8_1/><a8_0/><a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_1/><a3_0/> <a3_2>(<b10_0>1036.20 km<b10_0/>)<a3_2/>. The river length is significantly shortened <a9_2>from <a4_2>the river's natural course due to number of <a4_0><a4_1><a4_3><a4_4><a9_0><a9_1><a9_3><a9_4>canalisation projects<a9_4/><a9_3/><a9_1/><a9_0/><a4_4/><a4_3/><a4_1/><a4_0/> completed in the 19th and 20th century<a9_2/><a4_2/>.[note 7] The "total length of the Rhine", to the inclusion of Lake Constance and the Alpine Rhine is more difficult to measure objectively; it was cited as <b14_0>1,232 <a5_2>kilometres<b14_0/><a5_2/> (766 miles) by the Dutch Rijkswaterstaat in 2010.[note 1]
